Write-Up Text: People took to social media to express their opinions on the recently announced Federal Budget in Australia. While some applauded the focus on benefitting the most vulnerable others criticized its failure to deliver justice for the First Nations people. There were also debates on the allocation of funding in areas like mental health and housing. Overall the budget is seen as a balancing act amid the cost-of-living crisis and substantial debt inherited by the government. People also questioned the effectiveness of pledges related to issues like invasive species and bulk-billing.
